item.title: Incremental backup with rsync
item.description: The following script is responsible for keeping my files safely stored in a incremental way. Eventually it will be useful to someone, so I’m leaving it here. #!/bin/sh rsync -avh --backup-dir=$(date +%F) \ --exclude='sasaki/Downloads' \ --exclude='sasaki/.local/share/Trash' \ /home/sasaki /mnt/Backup/ The options -avh are pretty well known to almost everybody but I’ll explain briefly: recursively copy preserving some metadata, like permissions (a). Also, be sure to print whats going on (v) with human readable units (h).
